result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:36 PM Defendant John R Blasczyk in court, in custody.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for John R Blasczyk.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
All parties are ready to proceed on State's motion for forfeiture of wrong doing filed 9/16/22.  
Atty Schmidt calls Lt Bruckner who is sworn in and testifies.  
Atty Jochman cross examines the witness. 
Testimony closed. 
Court takes a recess. 
Matter recalled at 3:29 pm  Same appearances. 
Atty Schmidt gives closing statement.  
Atty Jochman makes closing statement. 
Court grants the motion for forfeiture of wrong doing as to reasons stated on the record. 
Matter remains as set.

Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  
Both matters set for jury status and jury trial.  Motions are set for today. 
State addresses the joinder motion and states reasons on the record to have the matters joined. 
Atty Jochman objects to the motion for reasons stated on the record. 
Court grants motion to join and states reasons on the record.
Court addresses the other acts motion filed by the State. 
Atty Schmidt makes statements as to the other acts motion. 
Atty Jachman argues motion on the record. 
Court grants the States other acts motion along with defense other acts motion for reasons stated on the record. 
Court sets a motion hearing for forfeiture of wrong doing in this matter with counsel.  State will check the availability of the witness.

8:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant John R Blasczyk in court, in custody.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for John R Blasczyk.  Town of Brookfield Police Department Lieutenant Gwendolyn Bruckner sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Gordon.  Cross examination by Attorney Jochman.  State rests.  State moves for bind over with argument.  Attorney Jochman objects to bind over with argument and moves to dismiss the felony counts in this case.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  State to file an information prior to the next hearing.  The date before the Trial Court shall remain as previously set.  Bail remains as fixed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Tyler Jochman
Order Served

The original document name was titled: Signed Protective Order
The original history event date is: 08-04-2022
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on August 4, 2022

Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A, Victim B and Witness A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.
The original document name was titled: Proposed Order
The original history event date is: 08-04-2022

Preliminary hearing on August 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on August 18, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant is not to come within 1.5 miles of Victim A/Victim B, listed in the Victim Identification Key, or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Court orders a protective order pursuant to 940.47 for Victim A listed in the Victim Identification Key.  Court further orders the protective order to be sealed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

08:33 AM Defendant John R Blasczyk in court, in custody, with attorney Tyler A Jochman as friend of the court.   Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Schmidt does request more time to be able to file a motion for joinder. 
Atty Jochman does accept receipt of the criminal complaint and waive reading, enter not guilty pleas.  
Atty Jochman requests preliminary hearing within 10 days. 
  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.
Atty Schmidt requests cash bail. 
Atty Jochman makes a statement as to bail.
Court sets cash bail. 
Court sets preliminary hearing within 10 days. 
Court to prepare protective order.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
